summary: The Reclaim the Reins Act (H.R. 3058) amends Chapter 8 of Title 5 of the United States Code to enhance congressional review of agency rulemaking. It mandates additional reporting requirements for agencies, including cost analyses and job impact assessments. The bill also introduces procedures for approving or disapproving revenue-increasing major rules and reviews existing rules. It appropriates funds for the Office of Management and Budget and the Comptroller General to implement these changes. Additionally, the Comptroller General is tasked with studying the economic costs of existing rules.
